tweets.content:
.
@AOC
 on Cuomo staying in the race: 

"I, as a Democrat, support the Dem nominee. It's disappointing to see how people want the party to rally behind the nom when that nom is them — & then ... that principle gets thrown out the window when the nom is ... someone they don't like"
Wow who would have thought that electing a rapist would have complicated the release of the Epstein Files?
BREAKING: Metadata shows the FBI’s ‘raw’ Jeffrey Epstein prison video was likely modified.
Circling back here

Freedom from kings.
Freedom from fascism.
Power to the people forever. 

Happy Independence Day

No matter how many times Trump or official gov’t accounts say it, the bill does not cut taxes on Social Security — because Social Security changes are prohibited in reconciliation. What it does is create a new tax deduction for seniors, subject to limits.
AOC: They’re giving people crumbs and they are taking away the whole loaf.
Tax cuts for billionaires are permanent in the big Republican bill. Tax cuts on tips expire in 2028.
https://nytimes.com/live/2025/07/03/us/trump-news-policy-bill/e98bb59b-fcd6-5461-a780-924a65bbf5c7?smid=url-share…

It’s not normal.

Lawler voted to make the tax breaks on billionaires PERMANENT while making the no tax on tips (just for those making less than $25k) EXPIRE in just 3 years.

He’s also kicking tipped employees off Medicaid, ACA, and clawing back their SNAP.

With this vote, Congress makes ICE the highest-funded federal law enforcement agency in history, with more money per year at its disposal over the next four years than the budgets of the FBI, DEA, ATF, US Marshals, and Bureau of Prisons combined.
Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez

Hmm! Was it 
@RepGarbarino
? 

After all, he “fell asleep” and conveniently missed the first vote on this bill.

Did he just wake up and decide to throw Long Island families off their healthcare? Because a speech by a Democrat made him sad?

They did not get any changes in this bill after it came back to the House. Zero. The bill that they criticized as horrible is the bill that they will be voting on -- and many of them voting for -- this afternoon.
This Congressman literally dumped stock in a Medicaid provider company right before this bill came to the Floor. Don’t be fooled—these guys know exactly what they’re doing.

ARIZONA: David Schweikert and Juan Ciscomani know this bill is horrible.
They just don’t think you’ll hold them accountable.

 Blow up their phones. Demand they vote NO on killing jobs, health care, and food aid: 202-224-3121.

The cynics will tell you that one vote won’t change anything.

But what they don’t tell you is that nothing can change without a vote.

The truth is, the world doesn’t belong to the cynics. It’s up to us.

New York: It’s time to vote.
Tuesday, June 25th.

Spread the word.
